Welcome to blob_tracking’s documentation!¶

Contents:

blobtrail¶

A class that defines a blob event in a sequence of frames from phantom camera data

class blobtrail.blobtrail(frames, event, frame0, shotnr, tau_max=7, thresh_dist=8.0, fwhm_max_idx=10, blob_ext=8, thresh_amp=0.6, doplots=False)[source]¶

A realization of a blob event and its associated trail input: =====

  • frames: Phantom frames

  • event: structured array (intensity, t0, R0, z0)

  • frame0: offset frame for frames array

  • shotnr: shotnr

  • tau_max: Maximal number of frames for fwd/bwd tracking

  • thresh_dist: Max. distance a peak is allowd to travel per frame

  • fwhm_max_idx:Maximum width allowed, in pixel

  • blob_ext: Size of the blob

  • thresh_amp: Threshold in percentage of original amplitude before a

    blob is considered to be lost by the tracker

  • doplots: Plot output

compute_fwhm(frames, rz_array=None, position='COM', norm=False, plots=False)[source]¶

Computes the FWHM of the detected blob at its maximum

Input:

frames: GPI data rz_array: 2d array with (R,z) value for each pixel. If

omitted, computes FWHM in pixels
position: Compute FWHM at center of mass ‘COM’ or maximum
‘MAX’

norm: Normalize intensity to maximum

compute_width_gaussian(frames, rz_array=None, position='MAX', i_size_max=12, plots=False)[source]¶

Attempts to fit a Gaussian to the peak

Input:

frames: GPI data rz_array: 2d array with (R,z) value for each pixel. If

omitted, computes FWHM in pixels
position: Compute FWHM at center of mass ‘COM’ or
maximum ‘MAX’
get_amp()[source]¶

Return the amplitude (maximum intensity) of the blob

get_blob_shape(frames, frameno=None, position='COM')[source]¶

Return a the shape of the blob centered around its COM position position: Return blob position at center of mass (‘COM’) or maximum (‘MAX’) frameno: Returns the blob shape in the specified range, this range must be within [-tau_b : tau_f]

get_ell_pol()[source]¶

Return the previously computed poloidal width of the blob

get_ell_rad()[source]¶

Return the previously computed radial width of the blob

get_err_ell_pol()[source]¶

Return error from length fitting

get_err_ell_rad()[source]¶

Return error from length fitting

get_event_frames()[source]¶

Return the frames in which the blob event occurs

get_frame0()[source]¶

The index for the frame where the blob was detected

get_tau()[source]¶

Return the frames in blob trail relative to the frame number where the blob was detected

get_trail_com(rz_array=None)[source]¶

Return the position of the blob COM. Either in pixel or in (R,Z) coordinates if rz_array is passed.

get_trail_max(rz_array=None)[source]¶

Return the position of the blob maximum. Either in pixel or in (R,Z) coordinates if rz_array is passed.

get_velocity_com(rz_array=None)[source]¶

Return the velocity of the blob COM. Either in pixel / frame of m/s when rz_array is given

get_velocity_max(rz_array=None)[source]¶

Return the velocity of the blob maximum. Either in pixel / frame of m/s when rz_array is given

plot_trail(frames, rz_array=None, xyi=None, trigger_box=None, sep_data=None, plot_com=False, plot_max=False, plot_shape=False, plot_geom=False, save_frames=False)[source]¶

Plot the motion of the blob. The GPI frames are to be supplied externally

Input:

frames: GPI data plot_com: Mark the center of mass of the blob plot_max: Mark the maximum of the blob plot_shape: If available, mark the FWHM of the blob plot_geom: Overplot triggering blox, limiter shadow and

separatrix

save_frames: Save the frames

track_backward(frames, doplots=False)[source]¶

Track blob backward frame0 to beginning of frames

track_forward(frames, doplots=False)[source]¶

Track blob forward from frame0
